title: Google\Cloud\Run\V2\RevisionTemplate
name: RevisionTemplate
description:
RevisionTemplate describes the data a revision should have when created from a template.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.run.v2.RevisionTemplate

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.revision
params.description: The unique name for the revision. If this field is omitted, it will be automatically generated based on the Service name.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: KRM-style labels for the resource.

params.name: data.annotations
params.description: KRM-style annotations for the resource.

params.name: data.scaling
params.description: Scaling settings for this Revision.

params.name: data.vpc_access
params.description: VPC Access configuration to use for this Revision. For more information, visit https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/connecting-vpc.

params.name: data.timeout
params.description: Max allowed time for an instance to respond to a request.

params.name: data.service_account
params.description: Email address of the IAM service account associated with the revision of the service. The service account represents the identity of the running revision, and determines what permissions the revision has. If not provided, the revision will use the project's default service account.

params.name: data.containers
params.description: Holds the single container that defines the unit of execution for this Revision.

params.name: data.volumes
params.description: A list of Volumes to make available to containers.

params.name: data.execution_environment
params.description: The sandbox environment to host this Revision.

params.name: data.encryption_key
params.description: A reference to a customer managed encryption key (CMEK) to use to encrypt this container image. For more information, go to https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/securing/using-cmek

params.name: data.max_instance_request_concurrency
params.description: Sets the maximum number of requests that each serving instance can receive.
